metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: From simple line charts to complex hierarchical tree maps, the Google Chart gallery provides a large number of ready-to-use chart types:
content.html: From simple line charts to complex hierarchical tree maps, the Google Chart gallery provides a large number of ready-to-use chart types:

content.text: To use Google Chart in your web page, add a link to the charts loader:
content.html: To use Google Chart in your web page, add a link to the charts loader:

content.code_html:
<script
src="https://www.gstatic.com/charts/loader.js">
</script>

content.text: Google Chart is easy to use.
Just add a <div> element to display the chart:
content.html: Just add a <div> element to display the chart:

content.code_html: <div id="myChart" style="max-width:700px; height:400px"></div>

content.text: The <div> element must have a unique id.
content.html: The <div> element must have a unique id.

content.text: Then load the Google Graph API:

content.code_html:
1 google.charts.load('current',{packages:['corechart']});

2 google.charts.setOnLoadCallback(drawChart);

function drawChart() {
// Set Data
 const data = google.visualization.arrayToDataTable([
  ['Price', 'Size'],
  [50,7],[60,8],[70,8],[80,9],[90,9],[100,9],
  [110,10],[120,11],[130,14],[140,14],[150,15]
  ]);
// Set Options
 const options = {
  title: 'House Prices vs Size',
  hAxis: {title: 'Square Meters'},
  vAxis: {title: 'Price in Millions'},
  legend: 'none'
};
// Draw Chart
 const chart = new google.visualization.LineChart(document.getElementById('myChart'));
chart.draw(data, options);
}

content.text: To scatter plot the same data, change google.visualization to ScatterChart:
content.html: To scatter plot the same data, change google.visualization to ScatterChart:

content.code_html: const chart = new google.visualization.LineChart(document.getElementById('myChart'));

function drawChart() {

const data = google.visualization.arrayToDataTable([
  ['Contry', 'Mhl'],
  ['Italy', 55],
  ['France', 49],
  ['Spain', 44],
  ['USA', 24],
  ['Argentina', 15]
]);

const options = {
  title: 'World Wide Wine Production'
};

const chart = new google.visualization.BarChart(document.getElementById('myChart'));
chart.draw(data, options);

}

content.text: To convert a Bar Chart to a Pie chart, just replace: google.visualization. BarChart with: google.visualization. PieChart
content.html:
To convert a Bar Chart to a Pie chart, just replace:

google.visualization.BarChart

with:

google.visualization.PieChart

content.code_html: const chart = new google.visualization.PieChart(document.getElementById('myChart'));

content.text: To display the Pie in 3D, just add is3D: true to the options:
content.html: To display the Pie in 3D, just add is3D: true to the options:

content.code_html:
const options = {
  title: 'World Wide Wine Production',
  is3D: true
};
